intro: Psorospermum cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
